title: Connecting the Dots | Diversifying into in-orbit servicing
summary: A growing in-orbit servicing opportunity is tempting satellite builders to branch out of communications, imagery, and other standard fare to get a foothold in this emerging market. So far this […]

title: Congress asks GAO for review of GeoXO weather satellite program
summary: The top Republican members of two oversight committees have asked the Government Accountability Office (GAO) to review a major new weather satellite program.

title: SpaceX moves launch of CRS-28 ISS resupply mission to Monday
summary: SpaceX will now attempt to launch the Crew Resupply Mission 28 (CRS-28) mission to the International Space Station (ISS) on June 5 at 11:47 PM EDT (15:47 UTC) from Launch Complex 39A (LC-39A) at the Kennedy Space Center in Florida. The window for this launch is instantaneous, which put pay to Sunday’s initial attempt due to high winds in the booster recovery zone.

title: UAE outlines plans for asteroid mission
summary: The United Arab Emirates has released new details about its planned mission to the main asteroid belt, one that is similar to an ongoing NASA mission.

title: Fixed-price satellite contracts earn high grades in Space Force report card
summary: Military satellites acquired under fixed-price contracts get high praise in a report submitted to Congress by the Department of the Air Force.

title: Northrop Grumman gets $80 million Air Force contract for satcom experiments
summary: The U.S. Air Force Research Laboratory awarded Northrop Grumman a contract worth $80.3 million to conduct communications experiments using multiple commercial space internet services.

title: NASA Awards Technical Workforce Training Contract
summary: NASA has selected Osi Vision, LLC of San Antonio, to provide program support and course development/delivery for NASA’s Academy of Program/Project & Engineering Leadership Knowledge Services (APPEL KS) activities for the Agency.

title: To keep Starliner flying, Boeing must make some hard choices
summary: "I think if they look back on it, they wouldn't do it again."

title: This Week In Spaceflight: China’s lunar plans, North Korea’s failed launch, and Starliner delays
summary: Reviewing this week in spaceflight and upcoming events, it’s been another busy period. China now claims to be on track to land humans on the Moon by 2030, North Korea’s recent orbital launch failed, and Starliner’s Crewed Flight Test has been delayed yet again.

title: Space-Comm Expo 2023 – Where Space Does Business
summary: Experts and innovators from across the space sector supply chain are convening at Space-Comm Expo, taking place 7-8 June 2023 at Farnborough International Exhibition & Conference Centre. Brought to the […]
